business.headline: Economy to grow 6.3-6.8% in FY26, US tariffs pose downside risk: GovernmentChief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said that high tariffs are expected to be "short-lived" as both countries are in talks for the removal of the 25 per cent penal tariff and a subsequent bilateral trade deal.
Jo Hai Thama Sa, Chal Niklega: Vijay Shekhar Sharma at Paytm AGMPaytm's AGM today began not with data or charts, but with Vijay Shekhar Sharma reciting a Hindi poem by Anand Ji from Varanasi.

Adani Airports to invest Rs 10,000 crore in Lucknow expansionThe investment will be made in phases and will focus on increasing capacity, modernising facilities, adopting new technology, and improving cargo infrastructure.

India's GDP growth accelerates to 7.8% in Q1 FY26, beats estimatesThe latest GDP data shows that India's economy started the financial year 2025-26 on a strong note, with overall GDP growth ahead of expectations amid global headwinds.

Reliance AGM: Why shares dropped over 2% despite Jio IPO buzz and AI pushAddressing shareholders, Mukesh Ambani promised that Jio has the potential to deliver value comparable to global leaders and called the IPO an "attractive opportunity" for investors.

Reliance teams up with Meta to bring enterprise AI solutions to IndiaThe joint venture will create AI platforms and tools based on Meta's open-source Llama models. These will be designed to help businesses improve efficiency across areas like customer service, sales, IT operations, finance, and more.
Sensex closes 271 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 270.92 points to close at 79,809.65, while the NSE Nifty lost 74.05 points to end at 24,426.85.

Jio IPO likely to make Dalal Street debut by 1st half of 2026Jio IPO: The announcement was made by Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani in his address to investors at the conglomerate's 48th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

Rupee falls to all-time low of 87.97 amid US tariff concernsA weaker rupee against the yuan could offer a partial cushion for exporters hit by US tariffs, making Indian products relatively cheaper compared to Chinese rivals. It could also help narrow India's trade deficit with China.

Reliance AGM 2025: Will Mukesh Ambani announce Jio IPO?The main talking point at the Reliance AGM will be information about the much-awaited initial public offerings (IPOs) of Jio Platforms and Reliance Retail finally get a timeline.

Sanjeev Sanyal hints at major overhaul in EPFO with 3.0 rolloutEconomist Sanjeev Sanyal has signalled that the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is gearing up for a major transformation, with the much-awaited EPFO 3.0 promising faster, simpler, and more digital-first services.

Trump's draconian tariffs may cost India $55-60 billion, warns Jefferies' Chris WoodChris Wood argues that the US tariffs are as much political as economic. He links the steep duties to Donald Trump's "personal pique" at being denied a role in resolving India-Pakistan tensions after their four-day conflict in May.

entertainment.headline: Cinematographers, the art of adding soul to film, and job that often goes unnoticedCinematographers shape how the audience feels in every scene of a film through light, framing, and movement. On this Cinematic Saturday, let's discuss how they can truly make or break a film.

Allu Arjun heads to Hyderabad after grandmother's death, Ram Charan cancels shootAllu Kanakaratnam, grandmother of actor Allu Arjun, died at 94 due to age-related causes. Actor Ram Charan cancelled 'Peddi' shoot, following her death.

Param Sundari box office Day 1: Sidharth-Janhvi's film earns over Rs 7 crore'Param Sundari', featuring actors Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, had a modest opening on its first day. The film released on August 29, 2025.

Metro In Dino OTT release: When and where to watch Anurag Basu's love storyDirector Anurag Basu's 'Metro…In Dino' (2025) is now streaming on Netflix India from August 29. The film is a spiritual sequel to his 2007 romantic-dramedy 'Life...In A Metro'.

Bhojpuri star Pawan Singh inappropriately touches co-star at event, faces backlashBhojpuri star Pawan Singh is trending for all the wrong reasons after a video shows him touching co-star Anjali Raghav without consent during a promotional event.

Chiranjeevi fan cycles 300 km to meet him, actor promises support for her childrenA woman named Rajeshwari pedalled all the way from Andhra Pradesh to Hyderabad to meet her idol, Chiranjeevi. The fan travelled 312 kilometres from Adoni to meet the star.

Ryan Reynolds' Instagram misses Blake Lively posts, split rumours swirlFans are speculating that Ryan Reynolds may have archived photos of Blake Lively on Instagram after failing to post for her birthday, further fuelling rumours about the state of their marriage.

Shodha review: Intriguing case overshadowed by lacklustre resolutionRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025Shodha Kannada series review: Starring Pawan Kumar, Siri Ravikumar and Arun Sagar in the lead, 'Shodha' presents a case set in Madikeri, Karnataka where a family deals with trust issues and mistaken identities.

Odum Kuthira Chadum Kuthira review: Fahadh Faasil in painfully unfunny comedyRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025Odum Kuthira Chadum Kuthira movie review: Director Althaf Salim's romantic comedy, starring Fahadh Faasil and Kalyani Priyadardhan, is an absurd romantic comedy that struggles to find its footing. Surprisingly, even Fahadh Faasil isn't able to elevate it.

Amaal Mallik recalls ex-partner calling him on her wedding day on Bigg Boss 19Amaal Mallik shared on 'Bigg Boss 19' how his ex-girlfriend called him on her wedding day, but he refused to go out of respect for his parents.

Jimin-Song Da-eun saga exposes toxic fan culture: Why idols in love are punishedBTS Jimin and Song Da-eun dating rumours sparked backlash among fans. In this week's K-fix, we will dive deep inside K-pop's toxic fan culture - no dating rules, and why idols keep apologising for falling in love.

Tu Pehli Tu Aakhri: SRK calls new The Ba***ds of Bollywood track his favouriteShah Rukh Khan expressed his fondness for the new track 'Tu Pehli Tu Aakhri' from 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. The series will premiere on September 18 on Netflix.

George Clooney, Adam Sandler's Jay Kelly gets standing ovation at Venice premiereActor George Clooney braved a sinus infection and rain for the premiere of Jay Kelly at Venice International Film Festival. His co-star Adam Sandler was also present at the screening as the movie received a standing ovation from the audience.

Do You Wanna Partner trailer: Tamannaah, Diana run beer start-up in quirky dramedyThe trailer for the comedy-drama 'Do You Wanna Partner', featuring actors Tamannaah Bhatia and Diana Penty, was released on August 29. The series highlights female friendship and entrepreneurship in a male-dominated society.

Param Sundari review: Sidharth-Janhvi can sell Kerala trips, not loveRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025'Param Sundari' review: Tushar Jalota's romantic comedy starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor delivers stunning Kerala visuals and good music, but lacks chemistry and a compelling story. Yet another predictable and forgettable Bollywood love story.
Zeenat Aman admits she once failed to recognise SabyasachiVeteran actor Zeenat Aman shares a nostalgic encounter with designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee at Mumbai's Taj hotel.

KBC 17: Isro scientist fails to answer Rs 25 lakh question. Can you?In the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Isro scientist to the hot seat, who quit the game at Rs 25 lakh. Can you answer the answer?

Anthony Ippolito to portray young Sylvester Stallone in biopic I Play RockyActor Anthony Ippolito is set to take on the role of young Sylvester Stallone in 'I Play Rocky'. The film reveals the true underdog story behind the making of the iconic 'Rocky' movie and Stallone's relentless pursuit of his dream.

Param Sundari X reviews: Sidharth-Janhvi shine in a film with weak second halfActors Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's 'Param Sundari' opens to mixed reactions. Audiences praise the chemistry, but criticise the predictable second half.

general news.headline: Family of 7 killed in Reasi, 4 dead in Ramban as heavy rain batters J&KA week of pounding rain has battered Jammu and Kashmir, leaving highways cut off, villages marooned, and hundreds stranded, with fresh landslides in Reasi and cloudbursts in Ramban.

Pointless rupture: The Economist's stinging take on Trump tariffs on IndiaThe Economist argues that alienating India was a 'grave mistake' by the US, and it could well be an opportunity for New Delhi to realise its claim of being a 'superpower-in-waiting'.

American brand is in the toilet: Ex-US security advisor on tariffs on IndiaFormer US NSA Jake Sullivan criticised Trump's heavy tariffs on India, saying they damage US-India ties, undermine America's global standing, and push New Delhi closer to China.

Jolly LLB 3 case: The irony of a courtroom comedy standing trial in a real courtJolly LLB 3, starring superstar Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi, is facing legal challenges even before its much-awaited September 19 release. Several lawyers and bar associations have filed Public Interest Litigations (PILs), alleging that the film mocks the judiciary and disrespects the legal profession.

Cinematographers, the art of adding soul to film, and job that often goes unnoticedCinematographers shape how the audience feels in every scene of a film through light, framing, and movement. On this Cinematic Saturday, let's discuss how they can truly make or break a film.

RCB announce Rs 25 lakh financial aid for families of Bengaluru stampede victimsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) announced that it would provide Rs 25 lakh in financial assistance to each of the families of the 11 fans who died in the stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on 4 June 2025.

Bank manager in Kochi bans beef in canteen, staff did this nextBank employees protested outside Canara Bank's Kochi office by serving beef to oppose an alleged beef ban imposed by the regional manager.

US court junks Trump tariffs as illegal, but he won't relent just yetThe US appeals court ruling on Trump tariffs will not take effect until October 14 to give the administration time to take the battle to the Supreme Court.

Nature's fury in 2025 is human-engineered. Let's accept itIndia's recent devastating floods are far from natural disasters happening in isolation. They have the unmistakable imprint of human activities.

Trump tariffs wreak havoc at home, Americans cry over price riseDespite promises to lower costs and make America affordable again, Donald Trump's tariffs and tax policies are driving up grocery and electricity prices in the US. This is adding hundreds of dollars to the household expenses of Americans. Experts warn the trend could worsen, hitting low-and middle-income families hardest.

Australian politician raises fist at journalist during presser. Video goes viralA video of an Australian politician raising a fist at a journalist during a press conference outside Queensland state parliament in Brisbane went viral on social media.

Indore student runs away from home to marry boyfriend, returns wedded to anotherShraddha told police she had planned to elope with her boyfriend Sarthak, but when he failed to show up at the station, she boarded a train to Ratlam and reconnected with another lover, Karandeep, an Indore-based electrician.

Natural vs lab-grown: Can Taylor Swift's ring shift the diamond debate?Taylor Swift's 'rare' old mine brilliant-cut engagement ring comes at a time when lab-grown diamonds are posing a strong challenge to the natural diamond industry. Could her choice swing the trend in quintessential 'Taylor Swift Effect' style?

Lalit Modi, shame on you: Sreesanth's wife fumes over releasing Harbhajan slap videoBhuvneshwari Sreesanth has criticised Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke for reopening the 2008 slap-gate scandal. The resurfacing of unseen footage has sparked fresh debate and controversy in cricket circles.

US shooter 'obsessed with killing children' exposes a teen mental health crisisRobin Westman, the 23-year-old who opened fire at a Minneapolis school, left behind a chilling trail of journals, trial runs, and a disturbing obsession with harming children. If this is what obsession looks like in adolescence, then maybe it's time we stopped treating teenage mental health as a soft issue.

Denied prasad, Delhi temple sewadar beaten to death by group of men, 1 arrestedA 35-year-old sewadar of Delhi's Kalkaji Temple died during treatment after being assaulted with sticks and fist blows by a group of men over 'chunni prasad'.

From Rajgir to North East: Hockey India's mission to take the game all overHockey India's mission is to take the game all over the country, with Rajgir being one of the early steps. Over the past few years, the federation has taken steps to bring hockey to revive interest in areas where the sport still finds a lot of love.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

PM Modi meets Governors in Tokyo, rides bullet train with Japanese PM Ishiba Live UpdatesPM Modi met governors of 16 Japanese prefectures, highlighting the potential of state-prefecture collaboration. He urged steps under the State-Prefecture Partnership Initiative, launched during the 15th Annual India-Japan Summit. PM Modi said the time had come to give a renewed push to state-prefecture engagement beyond the traditional focus on Tokyo and Delhi.

Battle against India is personal for Trump, his aide Navarro lets it slipPeter Navarro, President Trump's senior counsellor on trade, has given it away that the record-high tariffs against India are not just over Russian oil or trade. With his language and images in particular, Navarro has revealed that Trump and his cronies are making it personal against PM Modi. The attack is directed at India's civilisational roots.

Why did Tamil Nadu record its highest engineering admissions in 10 years?Tamil Nadu's TNEA 2025 analysis shows the highest engineering admissions in the last 10 years. Students seem to be rushing back to core engineering branches. But what is the reason behind it? What does the IT hiring turmoil have to do with it? And, what exactly do engineering colleges need to do now to sustain this shift?

Man stops wife from making obscene reels for Instagram, she attacks him with knifeIn Ghaziabad, a man alleged that his wife stabbed him after he tried to stop her from making obscene Instagram reels. Police confirmed an FIR has been registered with video evidence of the knife attack.

Video: Highway closed in Uttarakhand after boulder crashes down amid rain furyHeavy rains triggered landslides and cloudbursts in Uttarakhand, killing six, leaving 11 missing and blocking the Badrinath Highway at multiple points, stranding pilgrims and locals.

Meta accused of letting AI chatbots pose as celebs like Taylor Swift and flirt with usersAccording to the report, the Meta AI bots frequently insisted that they were the real stars. Moreover, it regularly pushes sexual chat, including invitations to meet up in person.

sports.headline: Team Liquid punch ticket to VCT EMEA Stage 2 grand final with win over BBLTeam Liquid edged past BBL Esports in a thrilling VCT EMEA Stage 2 playoff clash, booking their spot in the grand final. The result also confirmed Team Heretics' qualification for VALORANT Champions Paris 2025, while setting up a high-stakes lower bracket final tomorrow.

Djokovic jokes about injury after reaching US Open 4th round: Can't let rivals knowNovak Djokovic overcame a lower back injury to reach the US Open round 4. His victory makes him the oldest man to reach the last 16 since 1991.

RCB announce Rs 25 lakh financial aid for families of Bengaluru stampede victimsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) announced that it would provide Rs 25 lakh in financial assistance to each of the families of the 11 fans who died in the stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on 4 June 2025.

Pat Cummins set to miss New Zealand T20Is amid fitness concerns ahead of AshesAustralia's Test captain Pat Cummins is reportedly set to miss the upcoming T20I tour of New Zealand, with Cricket Australia prioritising his fitness ahead of the home Ashes series.

Townsend upsets No. 5 Mirra Andreeva, Fritz marches into fourth roundTaylor Townsend knocked out fifth seed Mirra Andreeva in straight sets to secure her place in the fourth round of a Grand Slam for only the second time in her career, while Taylor Fritz ensured steady progress with a four-set win over Swiss qualifier Jérôme Kym.

Watch: Nitish Rana, Digvesh Rathi's heated face off in Delhi Premier League 2025Nitish Rana's explosive unbeaten 134 helped West Delhi Lions chase down 202 in the DPL Eliminator match. The fiery face off with Digvesh Rathi added intensity to the thrilling victory and raised tensions on the field.

Dad hummed Bollywood classics at the crease, son Aaryavir Sehwag keeps it quietAaryavir Sehwag announced his debut in the senior level in the Delhi Premier League 2025 with composure beyond his years. The 17-year-old admitted to nerves but said he leaned on his father's advice to stay focused.

Sabalenka reacts to mid-match proposal at US Open: I looked at my boyfriendAryna Sabalenka shared a lighthearted message with her boyfriend, Georgios Frangulis, after witnessing a surprise marriage proposal in the stands during her US Open third-round match against Leylah Fernandez.

IPL sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi embraces kabaddi at PKL 12Teen cricket prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi swapped cricket whites for the kabaddi mat as he attended the grand opening of Pro Kabaddi League Season 12 in Visakhapatnam. The 14-year-old IPL sensation joined icons like Pullela Gopichand, Dhanraj Pillay, and Pardeep Narwal to kickstart a night of nostalgia, drama, and new milestones in India's premier kabaddi league.

Carlos Alcaraz opens up on possible knee injury after US Open 3rd round clashCarlos Alcaraz cruised past Luciano Darderi at the US Open despite needing a knee massage mid-match. The Spaniard called it a precaution and says he isn't worried, as he moved into the fourth round with a dominant straight-sets win.

US Open: Djokovic, Sabalenka march into 4th round, Krejcikova stuns NavarroNovak Djokovic battled through back pain to advance to the fourth round of the US Open, demonstrating his resilience and experience. In the women's draw, world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka exacted revenge on Leylah Fernandez with a straight-sets victory, underlining her strong form at Flushing Meadows. Meanwhile, Barbora Krejčíková recovered from a first-set deficit to defeat Emma Navarro 4-6, 6-4, 6-4.

Dad hummed Bollywood classics at the crease, son Aaryavir Sehwag keeps it quietAaryavir Sehwag announced his debut in the senior level in the Delhi Premier League 2025 with composure beyond his years. The 17-year-old admitted to nerves but said he leaned on his father's advice to stay focused.

Sabalenka reacts to mid-match proposal at US Open: I looked at my boyfriendAryna Sabalenka shared a lighthearted message with her boyfriend, Georgios Frangulis, after witnessing a surprise marriage proposal in the stands during her US Open third-round match against Leylah Fernandez.

IPL sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi embraces kabaddi at PKL 12Teen cricket prodigy Vaibhav Suryavanshi swapped cricket whites for the kabaddi mat as he attended the grand opening of Pro Kabaddi League Season 12 in Visakhapatnam. The 14-year-old IPL sensation joined icons like Pullela Gopichand, Dhanraj Pillay, and Pardeep Narwal to kickstart a night of nostalgia, drama, and new milestones in India's premier kabaddi league.

Carlos Alcaraz opens up on possible knee injury after US Open 3rd round clashCarlos Alcaraz cruised past Luciano Darderi at the US Open despite needing a knee massage mid-match. The Spaniard called it a precaution and says he isn't worried, as he moved into the fourth round with a dominant straight-sets win.

US Open: Djokovic, Sabalenka march into 4th round, Krejcikova stuns NavarroNovak Djokovic battled through back pain to advance to the fourth round of the US Open, demonstrating his resilience and experience. In the women's draw, world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka exacted revenge on Leylah Fernandez with a straight-sets victory, underlining her strong form at Flushing Meadows. Meanwhile, Barbora Krejčíková recovered from a first-set deficit to defeat Emma Navarro 4-6, 6-4, 6-4.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
